edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.proj1
Class MovieLibrary

java.lang.Object
  edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.proj1.MovieLibrary

public class MovieLibrary
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds the library of movies created from the file movies.txt and the searches and sorts to be preformed on them.

Author:
Satshabad

Field Summary
private  StringPointerPair[] actorList
          This holds a list of strings and pointers where the string is the name of the actor in the film and the pointer points to the movie in movieList.
private  StringPointerPair[] directorList
          This holds a list of strings and pointers where the string is the name of the director of the film and the pointer points to the movie in movieList.
private  StringPointerPair[] genreList
          This holds a list of strings and pointers where the string is the genre of the film and the pointer points to the movie in movieList.

          This holds a list of strings and pointers where the string is the name of the main actor in the film and the pointer points to the movie in movieList.

          This is the number of movies current in movieList.

public StringPointerPair[] binarySearch(StringPointerPair[] array,

Deprecated. 

This method has been replaced by linear search to add partial search functionality. it used to be a beautiful binary search method

Parameters:

search

private Movie[] search(StringPointerPair[] array,
                       java.lang.String target)
This Method searched linearly for partial matches to the String passes in the field of the the array of StringPointerPair objects.

Parameters:
array - the array of StringPointerPair objects to search
target - the string being search for
Returns:
an array of Movie objects which have a field that match the passed String

searchBy

public Movie[] searchBy(char c,
                        java.lang.String target)
This method searches movies by a criteria: Title, Actor, Genre, Director. It returns the matching movies in an array.

Parameters:
c - a char which is the first letter of the criteria to be searched for: t d g or a for Title, Director, Genre or Actor respectively
target - the String that is being searched for
Returns:
the array of Movie objects or null if char was not valid, if array is empty then no matches were found.

contains

private boolean contains(java.lang.String target,
                         java.lang.String containedIn)
This internal method finds out if a String is a subset of another String.

Parameters:
target - the potential subset String
containedIn - the potential superset String
Returns:
true if target is a subset of containedIn

movieListBy

public Movie[] movieListBy(char c)
This method sorts movies by a criteria: Title, Main actor, Genre, Director. It returns the matching movies in an array.

Parameters:
c - a char which is the first letter of the criteria to be searched for: t d g or m for Title, Director, Genre or Main actor respectively
Returns:
the array of Movie objects or null if char was not valid, if array is empty then no matches were found.

stringPointersToMovies

private Movie[] stringPointersToMovies(StringPointerPair[] array)
This internal method takes an array of StringPointerPairs and gives back an array of their corresponding Movies

Parameters:
array - the array of StringPointerPairs
Returns:
the array of corresponding Movies
